flow.descriptionCdata:
0e21ed45-68dc-47ca-8f99-2f18ef8be45c.0ceaed25-45cc-433a-883c-c4404e6a934c.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
0e21ed45-68dc-47ca-8f99-2f18ef8be45c.1749553b-5d1c-4759-b315-cd1dbeaa18ed.prompt=Should the operation check subfolders? WARNING this may be very slow 0e21ed45-68dc-47ca-8f99-2f18ef8be45c.6779ec4c-62fe-4eeb-86fc-ccf8890d34e1.description= 
Checks to see if a path points to a directory.

Input Parameters\:
source - the path to check
username - username to use when reading.
password - password to use when reading.

Responses\:
failure			- the operation failed. The path does not point to a directory.
success			- The operation succeeded.
0e21ed45-68dc-47ca-8f99-2f18ef8be45c.7307c5e0-f0dc-4c3e-8ce4-b3bb9027d8b8.description=
Executes an Expression (e.x value1 \=\= value2)

Input Parameters\:
value1 - the value to threshold with
value2 - the threshold to threshold against
operator - (\=\=, \!\=,  >, >\=, <, <\=) the type of threshold
okstring - string to push into returnResult if the threshold has not been passed
failedstring - string to push into the returnResult if the threshold has been passed

Responses\:
true - the expression is true
fales - the expression is false
0e21ed45-68dc-47ca-8f99-2f18ef8be45c.a84fea46-d625-4540-a6b7-fd98c572d7f7.description=
Compares a files size to a given threshold.

Input Parameters\:
source - The file to read
threshold - The threshold to compare the file size to (in bytes).
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host when reading.
password - Password for the user.

Responses\:
failure - The operation failed. The file probably could not be found.
greater than	- The file's size is larger than the threshold.
less than - The file's size is smaller than the threshold.
equal to - The file's size is the same as the threshold.

Extra Results\:
size - The file's size in bytes.
0e21ed45-68dc-47ca-8f99-2f18ef8be45c.d8e3f5d0-0921-41e7-961d-d36019c2eaa9.description=Iterates through a list of values.If the list changes while running, the updates will be appended to the list. Inputs\: list - The list to iterate through. separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the list. Returns\: The current element of the list, if the response is has more Responses\: has more - Another value was in the list, and has been returned. has no more - The iterator has gone fully through the list. This response will only be returned once per iteration through the list, a subsequent call to the Iterator will restart the Iteration through the list. failure - failed to process the list. Note\: Where the iterator is in the list is tracked by each step's unique id. Therefore you can iterate on the same list from multiple steps simultaneously. WARNING\: Any step that will use the results of this Iterator operation will, by default, attempt to assign that step's inputs from a flow variable. If this is left checked, then the first element of the iterator will be used for every cycle of iteration.. 0e21ed45-68dc-47ca-8f99-2f18ef8be45c.description=
Goes through a Windows directory and returns the name of the largest file.

Inputs\:
    source - The source directory.
    user - The username to run as.
    password - Password for user.
    recursive - Whether to recurse through sub-directories.
Values\: True, False

Responses\:
    success - Operation completed.
    failure - Directory is not accessible.

Results\:
    largestName - This is the primary output. The name of the largest file.
    size - The size of the largest file.

Note\:
If there are no files in the directory, 'Result' and 'largestResult' will be empty and 'size' will be 0.
0e21ed45-68dc-47ca-8f99-2f18ef8be45c.e235c352-8980-4960-bd5e-d9412ae3d84d.description=
Gets a list of files and folders in a directory.

Input Parameters\:
source - The directory to check.
delimiter - A delimiter to put between files and folders in the directory.
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host when reading.
password - Password for the user.

Returns\:
The children of the path.

Extra Results\:
count - The number of children.

Responses\:
failure - The operation failed. The path probably could not be found, or was a file.
success - The operation succeeded.
flow.name: Get Largest File
